text: The 2010–11 Kentucky Wildcats men's basketball team represented the University of Kentucky in the college basketball season of 2010–2011. The team's head coach is John Calipari, who entered his second season after posting a 35–3 record in his inaugural season. ==Pre-season== ===Departures=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Name !! Number !! Pos. !! Height !! Weight !! Year !! Hometown !! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | || 24 || G || || 190 || || Birmingham, Alabama || Entered the 2010 NBA Draft |- | || 15 || F/C || || 270 || || Mobile, Alabama || Entered the 2010 NBA Draft |- | || 3 || F || || 215 || || Greenbelt, Maryland || Academically ineligible |- | || 5 || G/F || || 218 || || Anchorage, Alaska || Graduated |- | || 12 || G || || 207 || || Newport, Kentucky || Graduated |- | || 33 || F/C || || 255 || || Oklahoma City, Oklahoma || Entered the 2010 NBA Draft |- | || 54 || F || || 235 || || Huntington, West Virginia || Entered the 2010 NBA Draft |- | || 21 || F || || 215 || || Lafayette, Louisiana || Graduated |- | || 11 || G || || 195 || || Raleigh, North Carolina || Entered the 2010 NBA Draft |} ===Recruiting=== ====Class of 2010 signees==== ====Class of 2011 commitments==== ==Roster== *Twany Beckham transferred from Mississippi State in January 2011. He was not eligible to play until December 2011. He was still able to practice and be a part of the roster, but was not on scholarship during spring 2011. ===Depth chart=== ==2010-2011 Schedule Notes== |- !colspan=12 style="background:#005DAA; color:white;"| Exhibition |- !colspan=12 style="background:#005DAA; color:white;"| Non-conference regular season |- !colspan=12 style="background:#005DAA; color:white;"| SEC regular season |- !colspan=12 style="background:#005DAA;"| SEC Tournament |- |- |- !colspan=12 style="background:#005DAA;"| NCAA Tournament ==Rankings== {| class="wikitable" style="white-space:nowrap;" |+ Ranking Movement Legend: ██ Increase in ranking. ██ Decrease in ranking. ██ Not ranked the previous week. |- !
